column4: Doesn't the kernel require root to burn CDs (at least affectively?)
at least not in warty...didnt try burning in hoary yet
it will get rewritten in python next time i find the time to touch it.....currently other stuff is more important to get written ;)
why did you break the safety of your system with a root pw ?
you are wrong, there is _no_ root pw
breezy wont be usable in the nest weeks...
there is not even half of it compiled on the buildd's
You said Breezy won't be usable for a few weeks. Is there danger in using it meanwhile.. I mean will I be forced to downgrade than upgrade?
nobody can predict what will happen
Ah.. well I seperated / from /home so in the worst case scenario I just have to reinstall Ubuntu on /
imagine mount has a weird bug that wipes your partition on the first mount ;)
its really not something for systems with useful data on them
at least not the first weeks
